title.rendered: India’s T20 WC jersey unveiled by Rohit Sharma and Jay Shah

content.rendered:
In a video posted by BCCI on its official X account, Rohit Sharma and Jay Shah were present at Narendra Modi’s stadium in Ahmedabad during the event.

“It’s time to welcome our team in a new color. Introducing the T201 jersey #TeamIndia with our Honorary Secretary @JayShah, Captain @lmRo45 and Official Kit Partner @adidas,” BCCI wrote in the post.

Sportswear giant Adidas also presented a team jacket along with the match shirt and practice jersey. Who showed the first look of the jersey a week ago in Dharamsala.

A giant-sized replica of the shirt flew over the HPCA stadium. Sharma and Shah and Shake on Monday, afterward, they went to the museum and home where Sharma signed in New Indian Jersey.

The shortest new video has a purple tradition and color, with the white clothes. The three stripes of Adidas logo are painted in white on the edge of the shirt while the tricolor stripe of the Indian flag adorns the collar of the shirt.

Adidas entered into a multi-year partnership with the BCCI in May 2023 after ending its partnership with the previous MPL sponsor. India are paired with rivals Pakistan, supporters Ireland, Canada and the USA in Group A. Sharma’s men begin their campaign against Ireland on June 5 at the National Cricket Stadium in Nassau County, New York, and will meet Pakistan on June 5. . June 9.

India’s fixtures:

India vs Ireland on June 5 (New York)
Pakistan vs India on June 9 (New York)
India vs USA on June 12 (New York)
Canada vs India on June 15 (Florida)

India’s squad:

Rohit Sharma (onyeisi), Hardik Pandya (osote onye isi), Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant (WK), Sanju Samson (WK), Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj.
Reserves: Shubman Gill, Rinku Singh, Khaleel Ahmed et Avesh Khan

Read Also: India squad for T20 World Cup 2024 announced.
